title: Historical Stock Splits and Corporate Actions of Telefonaktiebolaget LM Ericsson Stock

content.text: Date: January 26, 2006 - Ericsson acquired most of the assets of Marconi Communications, including its optical networking and broadband access portfolios.
Date: February 16, 2012 - Sony acquired Ericsson's 50% stake in Sony Ericsson, making it a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony.
Date: January 31, 2019 - Ericsson completed the divestment of 51% of its Media Solutions business, which became MediaKind.
Date: September 18, 2020 - Ericsson announced the acquisition of Cradlepoint, a leading provider of wireless edge WAN solutions.

news.headline: Ericsson (ERIC) & OPPO Ink Multi-Year Cross License Agreement
news.summary: Ericsson (ERIC) inks a multi-year global patent cross license agreement with OPPO to drive innovation and growth in cellular environments such as 5G technologies.

news.headline: Ericsson (ERIC) to Deploy AI Energy Saving Solutions in Jordan
news.summary: Ericsson (ERIC) is set to deploy cutting-edge artificial intelligence and machine learning solutions aimed at reducing energy consumption across Umniah's network operations in Jordan.

news.headline: Ericsson and OPPO sign global patent cross license agreement
news.summary: Ericsson (NASDAQ: ERIC) and OPPO have signed a multi-year global patent cross license agreement. This agreement includes a cross license covering patents essential to standards for cellular technologies, including 5G. OPPO, a leading smartphone vendor with sales in global markets, and significant presence in developing countries, will make royalty payments to Ericsson.

news.headline: Telefonaktiebolaget Lm Ericsson (publ) (ERIC) Q2 2024 Earnings Call Transcript
news.summary: ERIC earnings call for the period ending June 30, 2024.

news.headline: Ericsson Gets a Lift From North American Demand
news.summary: Ericsson reported better-than-expected revenue on a big jump in North American sales.

news.headline: Ericsson (ERIC) Q2 Earnings Miss Estimates, Top Line Falls
news.summary: Ericsson (ERIC) reports a top-line decline year over year owing to demand softness in the Networks segment. Sales growth in North America is a tailwind.

news.headline: Ericsson Gains Premarket After Q2 Print, What's Going On?
news.summary: Ericsson (NASDAQ:ERIC) reported second-quarter fiscal 2024 results. The stock price climbed after the print. Sales declined 7% year-over-year to 59.8 billion Swedish Krona. In USD, sales of $5.597 billion beat the analyst consensus estimate of $5.363 billion. The sales decline was due to an 11% decrease in Networks. Group organic sales declined by 7% Y/Y. Organic sales were stable in Cloud Software and Services and Enterprise. Adjusted gross margin improved to 43.9% from 38.3% Y/Y, driven primar

news.headline: Ericsson reports second quarter results 2024
news.summary: Strategic highlights – taking proactive action in a challenging market environment

news.headline: Ericsson's second-quarter sales beat helped by North American demand
news.summary: Ericsson and rival Nokia have shed thousands of jobs and cut costs as customers buy less 5G telecom equipment.  "We expect market conditions to remain challenging this year, as the pace of India investments slow, however our sales will benefit during the second half from contract deliveries in North America," CEO Börje Ekholm said.  In North America, sales rose by 14%.

news.headline: Ericsson (ERIC), Vodafone Team Up to Deploy 5G Antenna in Germany
news.summary: Vodafone selects Ericsson's (ERIC) cutting-edge antenna solution to accelerate network expansion across Germany.

news.headline: Ericsson Canada Recognized by Forbes as One of Canada's Best Employers for Diversity
news.summary: Ericsson (NASDAQ: ERIC) Canada has been named by Forbes as one of Canada's Best Employers for Diversity 2024, placing 38th out of 200 companies listed. This recognition highlights the company's commitment to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace, marking another significant milestone in its ongoing efforts to support DEI initiatives.

news.headline: Ericsson (ERIC) to Drive Digital Transformation in Thailand
news.summary: Ericsson (ERIC) unveils new initiative to revolutionize digital transformation in Thailand with its state-of-the-art 5G solutions.

news.headline: Ericsson (ERIC) to Report SEK 11.4B Non-cash Impairment Expense
news.summary: Ericsson (ERIC) is set to record a non-cash impairment charge of SEK 11.4 billion in the second quarter of 2024, associated with the Vonage acquisition.

news.headline: Ericsson shares fall after another $1 billion Vonage impairment charge
news.summary: Telecom equipment maker Ericsson has recorded another billion-dollar impairment charge for its acquisition of cloud communications firm Vonage in 2021, sending its shares down 2% in early trade.  Dubbed as one of its largest deals in history, Ericsson splurged $6.2 billion in cash to buy Vonage to help it target enterprise customers as it sought to diversify away from its mobile networks business.  Since then, mobile network revenue has fallen due to lower demand for 5G gear, Ericsson's share price has halved over an Iraq bribing scandal, and it took a $3 billion non-cash charge last year on the Vonage deal.

news.headline: Ericsson announces non-cash impairment charge mainly relating to Vonage
news.summary: Ericsson (NASDAQ: ERIC) today announces that, in accordance with IFRS accounting requirements, it will record a non-cash impairment charge of SEK 11.4 billion in the second quarter of 2024, primarily reflecting lower anticipated market growth rates in Vonage's current portfolio. The Net income impact after tax will be SEK 11.4 billion and reported in segment Enterprise.
